data.question: What are the two 2D metal–calixarene aggregates mentioned?
What metal ions are used in the synthesis of the 2D metal–calixarene aggregates?
What is the role of isonicotinic acid in the formation of the nanocages?
data.answer: It acts as a bridge, bonding the M4-calix[4] SBUs through their carboxylate groups and additional metal bridges through their N donors to form nanocages.

data.question: Can the coordination cages act as a host to incorporate various guests?
Is the gas sorption isotherm of CIAC-109 indicative of permanent microporosity?
Are the CIAC-109 and CIAC-110 compounds isostructural?
What is the significance of the shuttlecock-like M4-calix[4] SBU?
data.answer: It is an excellent secondary building unit for cluster construction and maintains the desired curvature necessary for the construction of coordination cages.

data.question: What is the purpose of using di- or ternary carboxylic acids in the synthesis of nanocages?
data.answer: They can be bridged by di- or ternary carboxylic acids into some nanocages through a [6+8] or [6+12] condensation.

data.question: Does the synthesis of CIAC-109 involve the use of triethylamine?
What is the crystal system and space group of CIAC-109?
data.answer: Tetragonal system with the space group I4/m

data.question: What is the role of {MCl2} units in the structure of the nanocages?
data.answer: They bridge two tail-to-tail dumbbells through the M–N bonds into a novel coordination cage.

data.question: Are the layers in CIAC-109 staggered and stacked alternately along the c axis?
What is the Langmuir surface area of CIAC-109?
Is the thermal decomposition of CIAC-109 used to produce a-Fe2O3?
What is the approximate size of the spherical cavity within the nanocages?
What is the significance of the fusiform apertures in the coordination cages?
data.answer: They are different from those across two adjacent SBUs found in the nanocages with planar ternary acids, indicating a unique structural feature.

data.question: Do CIAC-109 and CIAC-110 demonstrate gas sorption properties?
What is the role of the counterions in the 3D supramolecular structure?
data.answer: They participate in hydrogen bonds and electrostatic interactions, contributing to the stacking of layers into a 3D structure.

data.question: Is the synthesis of CIAC-110 similar to that of CIAC-109?
What is the purpose of the gas sorption isotherms conducted on CIAC-109?
data.answer: To confirm the architectural rigidity and porosity of the structure.
